action.action-desc: Ms. Barragán introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To give priority in allocation of rental assistance vouchers under the Veterans Affairs Supported Housing program of the Department of Housing and Urban Development to areas having the largest populations of homeless veterans, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Housing Homeless Veterans Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Paragraph (19) of section 8(o) of the United States Housing Act of 1937 (42 U.S.C. 1437f(o)(19)) is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraphs:

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law (including paragraph (6) under the heading Public and Indian Housing—Tenant-Based Rental Assistance in title II of division K of Public Law 115–31), in making amounts for assistance under this paragraph available among public housing agencies in each fiscal year, the Secretary shall give priority to public housing agencies that—

clause.text: serve areas having the highest numbers of homeless veterans; and
have fully utilized their available funds under this paragraph for the preceding fiscal year and have a demonstrated need for incremental assistance under this paragraph.

subparagraph.header: Reallocation of unused vouchers for VASH assistance

clause.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Secretary shall—

subclause.text: recapture from any public housing agency described in clause (ii) any amounts of assistance provided under this paragraph to the agency that are not—

item.text: committed under an agreement to enter into a housing assistance payments contract; or

committed, under a commitment of award letter that has been approved by the board of governors or other similar governing body of the public housing agency, for project-based voucher assistance for a project; and

subclause.text: reallocate any recaptured amounts to public housing authorities that have leased their entire allocation of assistance under this paragraph.

clause.text: An agency described in this clause is an agency whose jurisdiction is located within an area within which the homeless population has decreased, according to the point-in-time information of the Secretary for the two most recent reporting periods for such information.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to amounts made available—

paragraph.text: by paragraph (6) under the heading Public and Indian Housing—Tenant-Based Rental Assistance in title II of division K of Public Law 115–31, to the extent such amounts remain unobligated as of the date of the enactment of this Act; and
by any other provision of law enacted after the date of the enactment of this Act.
